pr_title: Remove the catalyst dependencies in backup transport

timeline.message: Remove catalyst connection, client, server, address, assert

timeline.bodyText: Is there any Java built-in or guava alternative of this listener we can use?
timeline.author: bf8086

replies.bodyText: The current implementation bounds the listeners with a shared thread context. So that all the listeners accept method will be executed by the same executor.
replies.author: LuQQiu

timeline.bodyText: Is this class needed? Will there be any problem running everything without this context?
timeline.author: bf8086

replies.bodyText:
This class mainly store two things, one executor, and one serializer.
In all the places, the current code makes sure that we read the response and write request to the same serializer.
all the requests are handled by the same executor, all the listeners acceptances are handled by the same executor.
It's more for the correctness and reduces the potential race conditions.
replies.author: LuQQiu

replies.bodyText: I took a deeper look into the code, the backup leader may create more than one bi-di stream (in case need to reconnect?) with the client, but all the streams shared the same context (same executor and serializer).
replies.author: LuQQiu

replies.bodyText:
I see. We can leave it as it for now.
For serializer we will probably replace it with protobuf built-in serialization. The gRPC also provide some guarantee in message order, so this class may eventually become unnecessary.
replies.author: bf8086
